column1:
The evaluation measures not the behavior itself (e.g., generating, editing, or moving nodes), but the degree to which that behavior alters the “semantic space” (idea space).
A score of 0 indicates no semantic change; scores from 1 to 3 reflect increasing levels of semantic impact, ranging from minor local adjustments to fundamental reframing.

column3: Total semantic score calculated across all six semantic dimensions.

column5: Whether new nodes or idea directions were added
column6:
AI：generated 5 new directions
Human：manually added a new node
column7:
0 = no new idea
 1 = adds 1 small new idea
 2 = adds 2–3 distinct ideas
 3 = adds >3 diverse ideas

column5: Whether concepts were blended to produce new combined ideas
column6: AI：combined two nodes and created a new one
column7:
0 = no blending
 1 = superficial linkage
 2 = clear cross-domain analogy
 3 = strong conceptual fusion creating new structure

column5: Whether the problem was reframed by changing perspectives, direction, or underlying assumptions
column6:
AI：generated content that shifted the problem direction
Human：edited AI content to shift the direction
column7: 0 = no reframing; 1 = minor adjustment; 2 = clear shift in perspective or assumption; 3 = full redefinition of the problem

column5: Whether evaluative actions were taken, such as judgment, critique, deletion, or prioritization (e.g., AI generating a critical card; user deleting or editing nodes)
column6:
AI：generated a critical card
Human：deleted certain nodes
column7: 0 = no evaluation; 1 = light preference/judgment; 2 = explicit critique or deletion; 3 = strong evaluative decision that changes direction

column5: Whether constraints were added or the design scope was narrowed
column6: human：added constraints while editing a node
column7: 0 = no constraint; 1 = small constraint; 2 = moderate narrowing of scope; 3 = strong constraint that determines feasibility

column5: Whether real-world knowledge, detail, or contextual information was added
column6:
AI：generated more detailed node content
Human：enriched node content with specific contextual details
column7: 0 = no domain knowledge; 1 = light contextual detail; 2 = moderate contextualization or process detail; 3 = deep professional or industry knowledge

column5: Whether the original user input includes details about users, design problems, or contextual specifics
column7: 0 = minimal input; 1 = basic task description; 2 = problem statement with context; 3 = complete design brief with scope + constraints + motivation

column6: User deleted multiple nodes based on judgment
column7: 1 = delete 1 node; 2 = delete 2–3 nodes; 3 = delete >3 nodes (strong critique)

column5: Whether the user selected nodes to transform into structure mode
column6: User selected multiple nodes and moved them into structure mode
column7: 1 = select 1 node; 2 = select 2–3 nodes; 3 = select multiple nodes (strong prioritization)

column5: Whether the user moved a node within the same quadrant in structure mode
column6: User repositioned a node within the same quadrant
column7: 1 = small repositioning within quadrant; 2 = noticeable repositioning; 3 = large repositioning (still within quadrant)

column5: Whether the user moved a node across different quadrants in structure mode
column6: User moved a node from one quadrant to another
column7: 2 = move across quadrants; 3 = multiple cross-quadrant moves or direction-level reframing
